responses: Hi, what can I do for you?
Hello, how can I help you today?
See you later, thanks for using the chatbot.
Bye! Hope to see you soon.

patterns: I am looking for transfer resources
How do I transfer to a four year university?
responses: You can find DVC's extensive transfer resources at https://www.dvc.edu/enrollment/transfer/.

patterns: What are my major transfer requirements
responses: You can find all major requirements at https://assist.org/ by selecting your academic year, current institution (Diablo Valley College) and other institution (your desired university).

patterns: How do I enroll in classes?
How can I sign up for classes?
How do I register for classes?
responses: To register for classes, start by logging in at https://www.4cd.edu/insite/. Go to Plan-Progress and then click on Plan and Register. There you will be able to plan your classes, see a timeline of your upcoming semesters at DVC, see different sections for classes and where to go in order to register. However, you will only be able to register when registration begins, so make sure to check your date.

patterns: How can I become a student at DVC?
responses: To become a student at DVC check out Enrollment Services at https://www.dvc.edu/enrollment/index.html. There is information about anything from admissions to class enrollment.

patterns: Where can I find tutoring resources?
How can I get some help on my homework?
Where can I find a tutor?
responses: For tutoring, visit https://www.dvc.edu/current/student-centers/index.html. There you will find student centers, both online and on-campus, for different interest areas: Arts, Communication and Language; Business, Computer Science, and Culinary; Math and Engineering; Science and Health; and Social Sciences. If you're not sure which one to choose, both the Pleasant Hill and San Ramon have Academic Support Centers where someone can help you.

patterns: Where can I find the catalog?
Where can I find a list of classes?
responses: To find all available classes, please visit https://www.dvc.edu/academics/schedules-and-catalogs/index.html. There you should find the class schedule and catalog for upcoming semesters.

patterns: How can I meet up with a counselor?
How to meet with a counselor?
How to reach the counselor office?
How can I schedule a meeting?
responses: To learn more about counseling, visit https://www.dvc.edu/enrollment/counseling/index.html. There you can find academic, wellness, or specialized counseling; you can also schedule both in-person and virtual appointments.

patterns: How can I get financial aid?
How to apply for financial aid?
How can I get money for school?
responses: For financial aid info, visit https://www.dvc.edu/student-services/financial-aid/index.html, where you can check your eligibility for grants, scholarships, loans, or work-study. You will also find info about the financial aid application process. To find more specific help, you can also find various workshops on financial aid options at https://www.dvc.edu/student-services/financial-aid/workshops.html. Also make sure to apply for federal student aid at https://studentaid.gov/h/apply-for-aid/fafsa.

patterns: Where can I get support for my disability?
Can I apply for disability support?
Do you have a disability support program?
How can I get support accommodations for my disability?
Where can I find help about my disability?
responses: To see DVC's disability support resources, go to https://www.dvc.edu/student-services/disability-support-services/index.html. There you can find information about DVC's Disability Support Services program. From their office you can easily apply for services, check out equipment, access tutoring, request accommodations, or set up an appointment with a DSS counselor.

patterns: When does the fall semester start?
When does the spring semester start?
When does the summer semester start?
Is there a day off soon?
responses: You can find the academic calendar and other important dates at https://www.dvc.edu/academics/calendars/index.html.

patterns: Where do I find ratings of professors?
responses: Rate My Professors is a great website to read about the experiences of other students who have previously taken a professor's class, and make more informed decisions during the enrollment period.

patterns: How can I get a degree from DVC?
responses: DVC offers associate degrees and certificates for many different programs. For more information, check https://www.dvc.edu/academics/programs.html.

patterns: How can I get a degree from DVC?
responses: DVC offers associate degrees and certificates for many different programs. For more information, check https://www.dvc.edu/academics/programs.html.
